CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: When the reverse voltage is greater than 2 V , recombination will be suppressed because of a high internal electric field and thus the current density becomes saturated ( J sat ).

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid "Material Name" entities:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| J sat |

The entity "J sat" clearly refers to a material name in the paragraph, specifically referring to the saturation current density.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: When the reverse voltage is greater than 2 V , recombination will be suppressed because of a high internal electric field and thus the current density becomes saturated ( J sat ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| reverse voltage |
| internal electric field |
| current density |
| saturation current density |

Note: "saturation current density" is not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph, but it can be inferred from the context as the current density that occurs when the reverse voltage is greater than 2 V and recombination is suppressed.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with only the entities that clearly refer to material properties:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| reverse voltage |
| internal electric field |

These two properties are directly related to the behavior of the material under discussion. "Saturation current density" is not explicitly mentioned, but it can be inferred from the context as the current density that occurs when the reverse voltage is greater than 2 V and recombination is suppressed.

The entity "2 V" refers to the threshold reverse voltage value above which recombination is suppressed, and "J sat" refers to the saturated current density. Both of these entities represent values of material properties.
